channel.title: World
channel.description: The Washington Post World section provides information and analysis of breaking world news stories. In addition to our world news and video, Post World News offers discussions and blogs on major international news and economic issues.

item.title: At least 36 killed at Indian actor’s political rally
item.dc:creator: Tobi Raji
item.description: At least 36 people were killed and dozens injured in a stampede Saturday at a political rally in India for a popular actor-turned-politician, authorities said.

item.title: Zelensky says Trump understands battlefield, has ‘faith in Ukraine’
item.dc:creator: Siobhán O'Grady
item.description: Zelensky, seeking weapons and support, told reporters Saturday that he shared his “visions” for the battlefield with Trump in New York.

item.title: State Department revokes visa for Colombian President Gustavo Petro
item.dc:creator: Andrew Jeong, Vivian Ho
item.description: The State Department accused Petro of urging U.S. soldiers to disobey orders in remarks at a pro-Palestinian rally in New York.

item.title: NBA basketball was huge in China. The league is hoping for a rebound.
item.dc:creator: Katrina Northrop, Lyric Li
item.description: The Brooklyn Nets and Phoenix Suns will play the first games in the lucrative Chinese market since the Houston Rockets controversy of 2019.

item.title: E.U. and Russia battle over Moldova’s future as elections loom
item.dc:creator: Mary Ilyushina
item.description: Moldova’s parliamentary elections Sunday are attracting deep interest as the small nation’s fate is seen as key to Europe’s future.

item.title: U.N. to reimpose sanctions on Iran after weeks of failed diplomacy
item.dc:creator: Karen DeYoung, John Hudson
item.description: Rebuffed by the Trump administration, Iran failed Friday in a last-ditch effort to prevent the “snapback” of global sanctions that were lifted as part of the 2015 nuclear deal.

item.title: Assata Shakur, Black Power militant who fled to Cuba, dies at 78
item.dc:creator: Emmanuel Felton, Anumita Kaur
item.description: Convicted of murdering a New Jersey state trooper, she escaped prison and fled the country. She called herself “a 20th-century escaped slave.”

item.title: Netanyahu tells U.N. that war will continue amid global backlash
item.dc:creator: John Hudson, Susannah George, Claire Parker
item.description: Benjamin Netanyahu castigated his “weak-kneed” critics and vowed to continue fighting Israel’s enemies until they are “gone” in a speech at the United Nations.

item.title: Canada Post to end home delivery; workers strike in protest
item.dc:creator: Matthew Brown
item.description: Canada Post is on pace to lose $1 billion this year, officials say. The Canadian Union of Postal Workers says it was blindsided by cost-cutting measures.

item.title: Eric Adams meets with Netanyahu amid mayoral race shaped by war in Gaza
item.dc:creator: Tobi Raji
item.description: New York Mayor Eric Adams said he was “proud” to meet with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu. His leading challenger has called for the Israeli leader’s arrest.

item.title: U.K. plans mandatory digital ID to clamp down on migrants working illegally
item.dc:creator: Karla Adam
item.description: The Labour prime minister announced the new ID requirement amid struggling poll numbers for his party and a rising global backlash against immigrants and asylum seekers.

item.title: After U.S. strikes, Iran increases work at mysterious underground site
item.dc:creator: Warren Strobel, Jarrett Ley
item.description: Satellite imagery indicates Iran is increasing construction at a deeply buried site in Pickaxe Mountain, just south of the Natanz nuclear facility hit by Israeli and U.S. strikes in June.

item.title: Russia is helping prepare China to attack Taiwan, documents suggest
item.dc:creator: Catherine Belton, Christian Shepherd
item.description: Russia is using its battlefield experience to give Chinese airborne units the training and technical knowhow to carry out lightning-fast operations.

item.title: For fleeing Gazans, even renting a spot to pitch a tent can cost too much
item.dc:creator: Miriam Berger, Louisa Loveluck, Siham Shamalakh
item.description: Tarpaulins and free slivers of earth are extremely rare as a quarter-million Palestinians flee Israel’s attack on Gaza City and crowd into pockets farther south.

item.title: Using the internet in South Korea? Prepare for the pornographic ads.
item.dc:creator: Frances Vinall
item.description: South Korea has faced a surge of explicit cartoon ads in recent years. Some depict violence against women, raising concerns over child welfare and online sexism.

item.title: Has Pakistan extended its nuclear umbrella to Riyadh? No one will say.
item.dc:creator: Rick Noack, Shaiq Hussain, Susannah George
item.description: As U.S. credibility erodes in the Persian Gulf, Saudi Arabia has signed a far-reaching mutual defense pact with Pakistan. But key details of the deal remain unclear.

item.title: A respected European statesman has praise for Trump
item.dc:creator: Ishaan Tharoor
item.description: “We’re going in the right direction,” said Finnish President Alexander Stubb of the war in Ukraine, “and I don’t think we’d be here without Trump.”
